info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 22 at 5:16PM EDT until June 22 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR EAST CENTRAL SHENANDOAH...SOUTH CENTRAL FREDERICK...CENTRAL WARREN...SOUTHWESTERN CLARKE AND NORTHERN RAPPAHANNOCK COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN VIRGINIA... At 515 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Strasburg, moving south at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. Locations impacted include... Front Royal, Strasburg, Middletown, Fort Valley, Arco, Seven Fountains, Dilbeck, Riverton, Reliance, Karo, Glen Echo, Nineveh, Cedarville, Buckton and Riverside. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
